intro: Secamone thouarsii, commonly known as the Madagascar secamone, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often elliptical in shape. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
